description.value:
Trigger A creature enters the area south of the ring of stones marked on the map

Effect A deluge of water rises up from the ring of stones, then flows forcefully down the passageway to drain into the pit at area F1b. Large and smaller creatures in the water's path must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|traits:damaging-effect] save. The rushing waters vanish instantly upon striking the pit floor, but do leave everything down there sopping wet.

Critical Success The creature withstands the force of the rushing waters and is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[1d10[bludgeoning]] damage as the rushing waters slam them into a cave wall.

Failure The creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Prone] by the rushing waters, takes @Damage[(1d10+6)[bludgeoning]] damage, and is pushed by the water to the spiky pit trap and triggers the trap.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature can't attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Grab an Edge] if they fall into the spiky pit trap.

details.description: Rivulets of water begin to run from the circle of stones to gather in a growing puddle at the center.
details.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20] (expert) to rub out the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Hidden] runes on the ceiling, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dispel Magic] (2nd level, counteract DC 18) to counteract the trap
details.reset: The magic rejuvenates over 10 minutes, after which it is recharged and ready to activate again.
